items.title: Sample Card component for use with CardView

props.name: className
props.docblock: The class name for the CardGrid component

description.text: The class name for the CardGrid component

props.name: columnSizes
props.docblock:
An object containing the desired column size at each breakpoint, following a similar
props API as ``react-bootstrap/Col``

description.text:
An object containing the desired column size at each breakpoint, following a similar
props API as ``react-bootstrap/Col``

props.name: CardComponent
props.docblock:
Your card component must be individualized to your table.
It will be called with props from the "row" of data it will display

description.text:
Your card component must be individualized to your table.
It will be called with props from the "row" of data it will display

props.name: selectionPlacement
props.docblock: If the Cards are selectable this prop determines from which side of the Card to show selection component.

description.text: If the Cards are selectable this prop determines from which side of the Card to show selection component.

props.docblock: Row data that is received from `react-table` API.

description.text: Row data that is received from `react-table` API.

props.name: data
props.docblock:
specifies the order and contents of the table's columns and provides display strings for each column's heading. It is composed of an ordered array of objects. Each object contains the following keys:

1. `label` (string or element; required) contains the display string for each column's heading.
2. `key` (string; required) maps that label to its corresponding datum for each row in `data`, to ensure table data are displayed in their appropriate columns.
3. `columnSortable` (boolean; optional) specifies at the column-level whether the column is sortable. If `columnSortable` is `true`, a sort button will be rendered in the column table heading. It is only required if `tableSortable` is set to `true`.
4. `onSort` (function; conditionally required) specifies what function is called when a sortable column is clicked. It is only required if the column's `columnSortable` is set to `true`.
5. `hideHeader` (boolean; optional) specifies at the column-level whether the column label is visible. A column that is sortable cannot have its label be hidden.
6. `width` (string; conditionally required) only if `hasFixedColumnWidths` is set to `true`, the `<td>` elements' `class` attributes will be set to this value. This allows restricting columns to specific widths. See [Bootstrap's grid documentation](https://getbootstrap.com/docs/4.0/layout/grid/) for `col` class names that can be used.

The order of objects in `columns` specifies the order of the columns in the table.

description.text:
specifies the order and contents of the table's columns and provides display strings for each column's heading. It is composed of an ordered array of objects. Each object contains the following keys:

1. `label` (string or element; required) contains the display string for each column's heading.
2. `key` (string; required) maps that label to its corresponding datum for each row in `data`, to ensure table data are displayed in their appropriate columns.
3. `columnSortable` (boolean; optional) specifies at the column-level whether the column is sortable. If `columnSortable` is `true`, a sort button will be rendered in the column table heading. It is only required if `tableSortable` is set to `true`.
4. `onSort` (function; conditionally required) specifies what function is called when a sortable column is clicked. It is only required if the column's `columnSortable` is set to `true`.
5. `hideHeader` (boolean; optional) specifies at the column-level whether the column label is visible. A column that is sortable cannot have its label be hidden.
6. `width` (string; conditionally required) only if `hasFixedColumnWidths` is set to `true`, the `<td>` elements' `class` attributes will be set to this value. This allows restricting columns to specific widths. See [Bootstrap's grid documentation](https://getbootstrap.com/docs/4.0/layout/grid/) for `col` class names that can be used.

The order of objects in `columns` specifies the order of the columns in the table.

props.name: columns
props.docblock:
specifies the order and contents of the table's columns and provides display strings for each column's heading. It is composed of an ordered array of objects. Each object contains the following keys:

1. `label` (string or element; required) contains the display string for each column's heading.
2. `key` (string; required) maps that label to its corresponding datum for each row in `data`, to ensure table data are displayed in their appropriate columns.
3. `columnSortable` (boolean; optional) specifies at the column-level whether the column is sortable. If `columnSortable` is `true`, a sort button will be rendered in the column table heading. It is only required if `tableSortable` is set to `true`.
4. `onSort` (function; conditionally required) specifies what function is called when a sortable column is clicked. It is only required if the column's `columnSortable` is set to `true`.
5. `hideHeader` (boolean; optional) specifies at the column-level whether the column label is visible. A column that is sortable cannot have its label be hidden.
6. `width` (string; conditionally required) only if `hasFixedColumnWidths` is set to `true`, the `<td>` elements' `class` attributes will be set to this value. This allows restricting columns to specific widths. See [Bootstrap's grid documentation](https://getbootstrap.com/docs/4.0/layout/grid/) for `col` class names that can be used.

The order of objects in `columns` specifies the order of the columns in the table.

description.text:
specifies the order and contents of the table's columns and provides display strings for each column's heading. It is composed of an ordered array of objects. Each object contains the following keys:

1. `label` (string or element; required) contains the display string for each column's heading.
2. `key` (string; required) maps that label to its corresponding datum for each row in `data`, to ensure table data are displayed in their appropriate columns.
3. `columnSortable` (boolean; optional) specifies at the column-level whether the column is sortable. If `columnSortable` is `true`, a sort button will be rendered in the column table heading. It is only required if `tableSortable` is set to `true`.
4. `onSort` (function; conditionally required) specifies what function is called when a sortable column is clicked. It is only required if the column's `columnSortable` is set to `true`.
5. `hideHeader` (boolean; optional) specifies at the column-level whether the column label is visible. A column that is sortable cannot have its label be hidden.
6. `width` (string; conditionally required) only if `hasFixedColumnWidths` is set to `true`, the `<td>` elements' `class` attributes will be set to this value. This allows restricting columns to specific widths. See [Bootstrap's grid documentation](https://getbootstrap.com/docs/4.0/layout/grid/) for `col` class names that can be used.

The order of objects in `columns` specifies the order of the columns in the table.

props.name: headingClassName
props.docblock: Specifies Bootstrap class names to apply to the table heading. Options are detailed in [Bootstrap's docs](https://getbootstrap.com/docs/4.0/content/tables/#table-head-options).

description.text: Specifies Bootstrap class names to apply to the table heading. Options are detailed in [Bootstrap's docs](https://getbootstrap.com/docs/4.0/content/tables/#table-head-options).

props.name: tableSortable
props.docblock: Specifies whether the table is sortable. This setting supercedes column-level sortability, so if it is `false`, no sortable components will be rendered.

description.text: Specifies whether the table is sortable. This setting supercedes column-level sortability, so if it is `false`, no sortable components will be rendered.

props.name: hasFixedColumnWidths
props.docblock: Specifies whether the table's columns have fixed widths. Every element in `columns` must define a `width` if this is `true`.

description.text: Specifies whether the table's columns have fixed widths. Every element in `columns` must define a `width` if this is `true`.

props.name: defaultSortedColumn
props.docblock: Specifies the key of the column that is sorted by default. It is only required if `tableSortable` is set to `true`.

description.text: Specifies the key of the column that is sorted by default. It is only required if `tableSortable` is set to `true`.

props.name: defaultSortDirection
props.docblock: Specifies the direction the `defaultSortedColumn` is sorted in by default; it will typically be either 'asc' or 'desc'. It is only required if `tableSortable` is set to `true`.

description.text: Specifies the direction the `defaultSortedColumn` is sorted in by default; it will typically be either 'asc' or 'desc'. It is only required if `tableSortable` is set to `true`.

props.name: sortButtonsScreenReaderText

type.name: custom

props.docblock:
Specifies the screen reader only text that accompanies the sort buttons for sortable columns. It takes the form of an object containing the following keys:

1. `asc`: (string) specifies the screen reader only text for sort buttons in the ascending state.
2. `desc`: (string) specifies the screen reader only text for sort buttons in the descending state.
3. `defaultText`: (string) specifies the screen reader only text for sort buttons that are not engaged.

It is only required if `tableSortable` is set to `true`.

Default:

```javascript
{
  asc: 'sort ascending',
  desc: 'sort descending',
  defaultText: 'click to sort',
}
```

description.text:
Specifies the screen reader only text that accompanies the sort buttons for sortable columns. It takes the form of an object containing the following keys:

1. `asc`: (string) specifies the screen reader only text for sort buttons in the ascending state.
2. `desc`: (string) specifies the screen reader only text for sort buttons in the descending state.
3. `defaultText`: (string) specifies the screen reader only text for sort buttons that are not engaged.

It is only required if `tableSortable` is set to `true`.

Default:

```javascript
{
  asc: 'sort ascending',
  desc: 'sort descending',
  defaultText: 'click to sort',
}
```

props.name: rowHeaderColumnKey
props.docblock:
Specifies the key for the column that should act as a row header. Rather than rendering as `<td>` elements,
cells in this column will render as `<th scope="row">`

description.text:
Specifies the key for the column that should act as a row header. Rather than rendering as `<td>` elements,
cells in this column will render as `<th scope="row">`
